coref: An Eagle sat high in the branches of a great Oak. An Eagle seemed very sad and drooping for An EagleAn Eagle. A Kite saw An Eagle. Why do you look so woebegone? asked A Kite. I want to get married, replied An Eagle, and I can't find a mate who can provide for A Kite as I should like. Take me, said A Kite; I am very strong, stronger even than A Kite! Do you really think you can provide for A Kite? asked An Eagle An Eagle eagerly. Why, of course, replied A Kite. That would be a very simple matter. I am so strong I can carry away an Ostrich in my talons as if an Ostrich in my talons were a feather! An Eagle An Eagle accepted A Kite immediately. But after the wedding, when A Kite flew away to find something to eat for A Kite bride, all A Kite had when A Kite returned, was a tiny Mouse. Is that an Ostrich in my talons about? said An EagleAn Eagle . To win you I would have said and promised anything, replied A Kite.
